author: Peerzada Ashiq
text:
Four Army personnel died after an avalanche hit the country’s highest military installation, situated at an altitude of 5,753 metres, in Ladakh’s Siachen on Saturday afternoon.

According to Udhampur-based defence spokesman S.D. Goswami, four Army jawans, deployed in the Siachen Glacier, were on a patrol in Ladakh region of Kashmir province.

The land route to the region remains cut off due to snowfall.

Though a rescue mission was launched immediately, they could not be saved.

Those who died were identified as Havildar Dorjey Gason, Havildar Tsewang Norboo, Rifleman Jigmat Chosdup and Rifleman Mohmmad Yusuf.

Chief Minister Mufti Muhammad Sayeed and Deputy Chief Minister Nirmal Singh expressed condolences.
title: Avalanche kills 4 soldiers in Siachen
